website_summaries.verdict: The Peltor Sport are worth considering for anyone who needs reliable sport earplugs with a convenient cord to keep them handy when not in use.
pros: Suitable for sporting events with loud noise levels such as shooting and racing
cons: Pricey option comes with only 3 pairs
Lower decibel protection than foam earplugs – rated for 26 decibels

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to range bag
customer_reviews.text: I generally use electronic ear protection when shooting outdoors or anywhere that communication or being able to hear surroundings is important but often times most electronic ear protection doesn't function well in indoor ranges so they just get turned off. So I started using these for indoor ranges so I didn't have to pack the big electronics and use them in other situations that the big ear muffs just get in the way. They work great
customer_reviews.author: Colin Matlock

customer_reviews.title: They don’t fall out and provide excellent noise cancellation
customer_reviews.text: What’s great about them: 1. Stays in your ears, no slippage 2. Blocks noise fantastically (including a jackhammer outside my bedroom window) 3. Comfortable Best for “back-sleepers”. Works well for “side-sleepers” also, but poke out a little. So if you’re a super light sleeper they might bother you. I love sharing a great find. If I was able to help answer some of your questions, please let me know by marking this review as helpful. I use your feedback to write other helpful reviews. Happy shopping!
customer_reviews.author: Red, RN

customer_reviews.title: Not soundproof in open shooting ranges!
customer_reviews.text: Initially I love it due to its size and easy to carry. So I wear it first time in an open shooting range but it disappointed me a big time. I clearly heard shock waves from the person (in the pic) who was shooting .45 caliber handguns (Israeli made) just next to me. My God! It’s so loud that it seemed I was not wearing any sound-proof earpiece. Even after the guy left, I still can hear loud shooting sounds from my neighbor shooter’s regular 9mm gun shooting. I guess it is not designed for range-shooting at all. Don’t believe those comments about perfect in shooting range. It may be only for light backyard mowing machine or soundproof sleep.
customer_reviews.author: RR

customer_reviews.title: Great fit and versatile for various needs.
customer_reviews.text: These are easy to wear and comfortable! I have very sensitive hearing and often need earplugs that are versatile and handy. These work well for controlling the loud volume in movie theaters and fit well in my pocket and can easily be worn with the cord behind my neck to keep from losing them when taken out of my ears. With the tapered flanges I can control the amount of noise reduction needed to allow me to hear a movie or I can block out more noise like a snoring husband! :) These can be washed as needed and used over and over.
customer_reviews.author: Cher B

customer_reviews.title: Great for Range Wear
customer_reviews.text: I have worn these to the shooting range twice now and they are fantastic! Previously I was using another variety of in-ear plug and while they did well at noise cancellation, they were very uncomfortable. These, on the other hand, are extremely comfortable. So comfortable, in fact, I almost walked out of the building forgetting I still had them in my ears. As far as noise cancellation, these are not deaf quiet, but it's plenty for a shooting range. I haven't tested them in any other venue, but I'd have to assume they'd be great anywhere you need them. I'm very glad I didn't spring for a more expensive earplug and got these instead. You really can't beat the price.
customer_reviews.author: Kris P

customer_reviews.title: Great but not for sleeping
customer_reviews.text: Peltor makes a great product and these plugs would work well for any other application....But... I bought these to sleep in and mostly sleep with my head to the side. The plugs have a solid plastic body which gets pushed in by my pillow. That's my only complaint. I'm off to find a soft polymer plug to use instead. These Peltor plugs will just get repurposed for something else.
customer_reviews.author: prettygirl357

customer_reviews.title: Best ear plugs ever.
customer_reviews.text: No exaggeration, this type of ear plug shuts out about 98% of all noise, unlike the more popular and widespread foam-type of ear plugs that, in my experience, shut out only about 25% of noise. I've bought the Peltor product many times and will not settle for any other type of ear plug again.
customer_reviews.author: RandFan

customer_reviews.title: Don’t block sound much
customer_reviews.text: Sorry to say, these earplugs do very little to reduce noise. I would not recommend them. In fact, the basic foam ear plugs do a better job. They are comfortable and fit in my ears snugly, but what good is that if they don’t keep sound out? I shared a room with a friend who snores quite loudly and these did almost nothing to block the sound. Can not recommend for anything.
customer_reviews.author: Catlady

customer_reviews.title: I've been using these for two years and they are great
customer_reviews.text: I've been using these for more than two years now. I bought a few packs because I lose small things easy. First, I bought them for the range and they worked very well. Then I started using them to sleep with and they worked great. Sleeping with them took a little getting used to since I'd never used ear plugs to sleep with, but after a couple days, they felt fine. The strap that keeps two plugs together breaks off pretty easy, but the plugs still work great and I have little pouches that I keep pairs in, so it's easy to keep them together.
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: What?
customer_reviews.text: These are my favorite earplugs for all uses including shooting. I usually cut off the connector plastic and throw a pair in my pocket when I go to concerts, live music, monster trucks, yard work, racing, shooting, etc. They fit my ears perfectly and don't hurt after wearing a few hours. Zero complaints other than I lose them all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Jones

customer_reviews.title: Very good earplug
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for when I do yard work because I have ears that are sensitive to loud sounds such as my lawn mower. I began getting worried about protecting my hearing when doing yard work because I started noticing I had occasional difficulty hearing for a couple hours after I finished. These ear plugs have proven themselves very useful as they block out majority of the noise from the mower and I have noticed no further hearing difficulty after completing mowing. If you need some short term ear protection for a couple hours I would recommend this product its both comfortable and effective.
customer_reviews.author: EM

customer_reviews.title: Permanently secured cord
customer_reviews.text: I originally bought the Mack's with the cord; however, you can pull the cord out of those; and I lost one of the ear plugs that way (in the yard, after it snagged on a branch). These Peltors have the cord molded into the ear plug, so you won't have that problem. Pros: The silicone is soft. They are easy to wash off. Permanent mounted cord. Cons: Peltor ships these with the cord rolled up, and one was tied pretty tightly in a knot. And after taking them out, the cord was kinked. I warmed up a cup of hot (not boiling) water, and heated them up for a few minutes, then stretched them out to remove the kink.
customer_reviews.author: aTypicalEngineer808

customer_reviews.title: perfect for music festivals!
customer_reviews.text: I had purchased a different pair of earplugs to try out at different music festivals and I found that these plugs worked the best. Since it comes in a multi-pack, myself and others in my group were able to try them out as well, and we all shared a similar preference for these. They lower sound perfectly and you're still able to talk to people around you without having to take them out of your ears.
customer_reviews.author: M S

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because my roommate talks on the phone really really loud and can hear her through my wall, and considering it is finals week I need a quiet place to study. Unfortunately, these are not 100% soundproof and can STILL hear here through my wall even with these in my ear, although, they have helped with canceling out her voice somewhat it sucks that I can still hear her. I am a college student and sadly can't afford better ones so these will have to do. But if you can afford better ones, you might want to get ones that work 100%.
customer_reviews.author: linda f.

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as I had hoped
customer_reviews.text: I have severe hearing loss so I try to protect what I have left and after wearing these a couple of times I'm tossing them. Perhaps ok for those who have normal hearing or just need mild protection but for people who are trying to block out more noise these don't seem to work.
customer_reviews.author: Sartoris

customer_reviews.title: Versatile and low profile
customer_reviews.text: These fit in my ear well and cancel out noise almost as well as my over ear protection. I use an industrial Stihl blower at my job and when I have these in, it sounds far away. Definitely recommend if you work outside in the heat and don’t want big bulky over head protection. Would not recommend for the shooting range. Protect you hearing! Note: they don’t last very long when doing rigorous work every day, so you will have to replace them. To be expected though.
customer_reviews.author: Noah P

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for double up at  indoor range
customer_reviews.text: I recently bought these for the indoor range. They are super comfortable and fit snug. I didn't buy these for singular use but to pair with ear muffs. By themselves they might be a little light for heavy firearm or indoors use but for me they were perfect to double up. Maybe for small caliber they would be fine but the guy next to me was shooting a 500 magnum and these plugs were overwhelmed (as would most) but were great under some muffs. They'll definitely be a part of my range bag.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor917

customer_reviews.title: miles ahead of foam earplugs
customer_reviews.text: My favorite earplugs. I use them for riding motorcycles, subways, and airplanes. They stay in my ears, and with use a few times a week, they last a good long time (a year maybe?). For frequent earplug users, these are miles ahead of the foam ones. Also, foam earplugs can be difficult to use properly. I see lots of people walking around with foam earplugs hanging 3/4 out of their ears. No such problem with these.
customer_reviews.author: Alex L.

customer_reviews.title: passable
customer_reviews.text: good but not great. the best feature of these earbuds is the molded section of the earplug that allows you to "drill" it snug into your ear canal but even when these ear plugs are well seated they seem to provide inferior hearing protection and comfort when compared with the standard 3m corded ear plugs (3M 90716-80025T) whcih are similarly priced and come with a hard shell carrying case that is actually useful.
customer_reviews.author: Drew D

customer_reviews.title: worth it
customer_reviews.text: i have tinnitus and hearing loss in one ear, so ear plugs help in noisy areas. these are excellent - provide good sound blocking, good fit, easily cleaned, and quite durable - compared to the squishy foam variety. i cut the string holding one pair together, and i'm still trying to find the 2nd one. word to the wise. though more expensive than the foam variety, i think they're worth every penny. would buy again for sure.
customer_reviews.author: curmudgeN

customer_reviews.title: Best product and VALUE by far!
customer_reviews.text: These work and fit amazingly well for reducing loud music, spouse snoring and other noises. It is also a relatively great value. I play in a band and have tried many other products (including Hearos brand items) that cost far more, but logically should cost about $1 or less for a piece of latex or foam (with more material in the packages and cases than the dainty plugs). The cord connecting the plugs is very practical and essential as it keeps them from getting lost. The Peltor brand is the best product and value by far and I use them more than the others tried.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Decent silicone plugs
customer_reviews.text: These were a good replacement for the older set of plugs I used but they aren't quite as nice. On two of the three sets of plugs the flanges buckle and create an angled edge so it scratches the inside of my ear canal. They don't fit 100% right so the noise reduction takes a hit and they get very uncomfortable after an hour or more. Swapping the sides and applying them with water didn't remedy the issue.
customer_reviews.author: S. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: The best...
customer_reviews.text: I live by earplugs. Have tried them all. Have also tried "noise cancelling head phones". These Peltor earplugs are the absolute best. They fit snugly and comfortably and do an ace job of blocking sound. I remove the little cords, but some people probably prefer to keep them on--they do help in avoiding misplacing the little plugs... In either case, buy these and enjoy the quiet...
customer_reviews.author: Joanne S.

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to use while mowing the lawn. They don't stay in. After walking behind the mower for 2 minutes or so, they pop out. It's back to reliable foam earplugs for us. Do not waste your money if you plan to use these while doing any kind of activity. They also can't be used while sleeping - too uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.author: J&C

customer_reviews.title: Good earplugs
customer_reviews.text: Got these because I work in a noisy office (radio station always playing, co workers having phone calls and side conversations, etc) and often have trouble concentrating with multiple sources of noise. These work great to block that out. Knocked off a star because they aren't very comfortable in my ears for long periods of time; I usually pop them in when I need a 20 minute "noise break."
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey

customer_reviews.title: They didn't work well at all. I had to ...
customer_reviews.text: They didn't work well at all. I had to really stick them way in my ear just to get some kind of sound protection. I had them all the way in there and even when I moved my head it wouldn't keep the seal in my ear. It started to itch after a while too, I might have had them in there too far. Lasted 10 minutes before I had to switch to the disposable orange ear plugs again. They are cheaper at Walmart if you still really want to give them a go.
customer_reviews.author: Pete

customer_reviews.title: Best Ever.
customer_reviews.text: These are the best earplugs! I use them for festivals and concerts. Why? - They glow in the blacklight so they're easy to find - Cord helps them stay on your neck - Affordable - Comfortable for my ear shape - JUST AS GOOD AS ANY OTHER ETYMONIC EAR PLUGS AND 1/3 OF THE PRICE If you're looking for this style, these are IT. I didn't like Earasers, Ear Peace or Dubs. They either don't fit in my ears or they're too easy to lose.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect 10/10
customer_reviews.text: Love these ear plugs. Bought a second pack to always have some in every range/ammo bag and on every hunt. Comfortable enough for hours in your ear, but suppressive enough to block out all but the biggest (like .416 Rigby) of rifle calibers. Plus the high visibility green means they don't grow feet and wander off like most plugs
customer_reviews.author: m.wallace

customer_reviews.title: would not recommend, will not rebuy
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like them. I am trying to reduce my waste so I had high hopes for these earplugs because they are 'reusable'. In reality, the strings detached within a couple of weeks. They are also somewhat uncomfortable - you definitely won't be able to sleep with them in. Noise cancellation is worse than foam earplugs. So overall, I wouldn't call them reusable because you will not want or be able to reuse them after a month or so.
customer_reviews.author: Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Good.
customer_reviews.text: Got these for myself and photographers I oversee to photograph concerts. Very comfortable and cancels out noise well. The yellow color also helps locate them. The bags are also useful since I just throw them in my photo bag and they are never dirty or tangled because of the bag. Overall everyone was happy with them.
customer_reviews.author: Mad

customer_reviews.title: The regular foam ear tips never fit in my ears and I hate twisting those things
customer_reviews.text: I use these for motorcycle riding instead of earbuds sometimes in case I ride with others and need to talk once in a while at stops. The regular foam ear tips never fit in my ears and I hate twisting those things, so these are much easier to insert and have stay. It's hard to beat the price also because it comes with a few and I can store extras wherever in case I leave a pair at home or in my jacket. I ended up ripping off the chord so they're separate and it works perfectly fine. I like these, although they do start to hurt after an hour and a half or so of riding.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't stay in my ears
customer_reviews.text: I ended up having to throw these away shorty after I brought them, because they just wouldn't stay in my ears. They would slip out, or not fully sit in my ear. Then since it wasn't in my ear all of the way, no noise would be blocked. May work well for others, but I have to ear over the head ear muffs.
customer_reviews.author: Khamiko K.

customer_reviews.title: Favorite Ear Plugs
customer_reviews.text: These have become my favorite plugs- I have medium to small ears, and have trouble with some of the foam ear plugs not seating in properly, and actually causing bad tinnitus, so I am very picky. I use ear muffs over these when shooting firearms and it works great, even for magnums and high calibers.
customer_reviews.author: redfishmike

customer_reviews.title: Excellent noise reduction
customer_reviews.text: These by far cut the volume more than any other earplug I've ever used. The stem style makes them easy to insert. The only downside is the cord does not last very long. It was actually the corded style that made me try these in the first place. I have decided they are good enough to keep using after the cord breaks off.
customer_reviews.author: xs

customer_reviews.title: Peltor Reusable ear-plug
customer_reviews.text: Best Noise Buster! Good price, perfect fit, washable, reusable Bought 2nd set for car, bedside table, desk drawer, and even to take along in my purse! I cut the cord from some of them and gave a pair to a friend who sings and plays musical instruments. Excellent for practice singing in choir and especially while vacuuming!
customer_reviews.author: learning.4.ever

customer_reviews.title: Not for sleeping
customer_reviews.text: I didn't see that the description mentioned the center plastic piece is a hard plastic that will make it impossible to sleep on these. I avoided several that were described as such, but had high hopes for these. They would be adequate for other uses, just not side sleepers blocking snorers.
customer_reviews.author: KeyLime

customer_reviews.title: They "Take the Edge Off" of Noise
customer_reviews.text: These earplugs are pretty good! They are comfortable and easy to clean. Personally, I find that they "take the edge" off of noise, as opposed to truly blocking it. For the price, they are an excellent value. It's nice to be able to keep a pair in my purse, a pair at home, etc. The color is pretty bright, as shown, but I find that if I wear them with the wire part behind my head and under my hair, it's more discreet. For me, these serve the purpose of dulling & softening sounds (though not eliminating them) when noise gets to be too much. Would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: LP

customer_reviews.title: Good price, comfortable, neck cord securely attached!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered 3 3 pack pairs (total of 9 pairs). The earplugs and cord are highly visible and neck cord is securely attached. Beware that many earplug cords are a shoe string with the string tips slipped into a hole in the earplug. A tug on the earplug can separate the earplug from the cord with resulting potential loss of the earplug.
customer_reviews.author: dsmith

customer_reviews.title: Not for motorcycle riders or those with larger ear canals
customer_reviews.text: Did not fit my ears well. I think they are dangerously long for those like me who need a larger diameter. I felt like I was pushing them in way too far to be able to get a good seal at which point they were very uncomfortable. Also, they have a long, stiff stem that gets in the way when putting on a motorcycle helmet so they would not be well sealed when my helmet was on.
customer_reviews.author: Ragged Clown

customer_reviews.title: good deal
customer_reviews.text: I'm using these for the gun range for the rifle. The over ear protection gets in the way. They work really well, but come lose if it gets too warm/humid. I have also used this with my over ear protection for extra sound proofing. I like them and you cannot beat the price.
customer_reviews.author: J. Amabile

customer_reviews.title: Not good enough for indoor gun range
customer_reviews.text: These work well enough, but getting them to make a seal isn't as easy as it is with the squishy foam kind. And even if/when you do manage to get that level of seal, they sometimes back out a little. If your hearing truly depends on these, get something else. They are good enough for outdoor shooting to an extent, but no way would I use them at an indoor range.
customer_reviews.author: Heofenum

customer_reviews.title: What I can’t hear you!
customer_reviews.text: I use these for power tools and shooting trap! I like these over wearing those earmuffs! With the cord you can pop the plugs in and out and keep them around your neck. If people need to get your attention you can still hear them but they need to speak up or yell! These do muffle the sound around you pretty good.
customer_reviews.author: christina gifford

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend
customer_reviews.text: The price is great and the do work. I am not super pleased about the time it takes to put them on, since you need both hands for each ear - at least if you follow the instructions. It also takes some time to make sure you put them on correctly. Once on, you do understand they are functional. Not dead quiet, but definitely efficient. Took one star off because of my personal preference of just put-and-go, but would still recommend them to anyone. The price is great and they do work as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: EM

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for me
customer_reviews.text: I play cymbals in a marching band. Normally, after playing for about an hour, I have ringing in my ears. I bought a pack of these earplugs because I don't really like the thought of losing my hearing at a young age. I can crash the cymbals now as loud as I want without even blinking. Note, the earplugs in the picture are not a picture of the latest version. The newer version has a different material string connecting the two. I will hopefully upload a picture soon of what they actually look like. They are very comfortable and stay in my ears. The rest of the band is jealous!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: I’ve been using these for years
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using this product for a few years now. While they’re very comfortable and it’s nice to be able to hand-wash and reuse them, the noise cancellation could be a little better. They’re a little small. Fine for my purposes though (handy for flights and every once in a while at night).
customer_reviews.author: JRAD

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: I use foam ear plugs a lot when I go to the shooting range. However, I wanted some ear plugs that would be easier (faster) to put in my ears. These ear plugs did not work at all. Both me and my girlfriend, who has a smaller ear canal than I do, tried these and we could hear each other whispering several feet away. They immediately went into the garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: do not work
customer_reviews.text: these absolutely do not work. i am wearing them right now, and i can hear myself typing as I write this review. i can still hear the central a/c in my office. i can hear that one bird squawking outside the window. I got these originally because i didn't want to contribute to waste any more than i had to by using the foam earplugs... but it seems that for now that's the best option, since these serve almost no function.
customer_reviews.author: meesha

customer_reviews.title: You get what....!
customer_reviews.text: Well, not much to be said about it. Poor quality built, material and design. Difficult to put in ear and keeping it in. Barely blocks regular noise. I could have gotten another one with much better results for an additional $5. So disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: SVVV

customer_reviews.title: Not comfortable for side sleeping
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to block out city and apartment noise while sleeping. They block out sound well and I'm very pleased with them. The string doesn't bother me at night. It is mildly annoying to have to use two hands to insert them when I'm half asleep in the middle of the night (you do have to follow the directions and pull up on your ear while inserting). The only downside is they have plastic handle/grippers that poke if you try to roll onto your side. I'm sure they would be great for yard work, shooting range, and air travel.
customer_reviews.author: Rock Finder

customer_reviews.title: These are my favorite ear plugs. Easy in and out with a cord so they don't get lost.
customer_reviews.text: These ear plugs are comfortable soft rubber and come with a small carrying case. They decrease loudness about 10db - enough to lower the volume and still hear everything clearly. They are easy to insert and remove and the cord keeps them from getting lost or being dropped when taking them out. I wear them at movie theaters when the previews or the movie are way too loud and on loud trains.
customer_reviews.author: R. Brooks

customer_reviews.title: Well made and fit well.
customer_reviews.text: I've had something similar to these before and the little strings that keep them together would break. I have used these a number of times when shooting and even when taking a nap to keep people outside from waking me from my hour of peace and sleep time. I must say these are doing very nicely and haven't even had the chance to use the rest that came with them as I'm still on the first pair. These fit very well and blocks out around 80% of the sound that's around me. I recommend these to anyone that wants some peace and quite or someone that needs them for shooting.
customer_reviews.author: HYG

customer_reviews.title: Love these.
customer_reviews.text: I'm about to purchase my second pack of these earplugs. I bought the first set last year in March. I wear them every single night while I'm sleeping. I love these. I've gone through a few kinds of earplugs, but these are the best . I don't recommend wearing them to sleep for everyone since they are not made to be worn while sleeping. But I'm used to it. I used to sleep with headphone ear buds in my ear to keep noise out. Sleeping with these isn't that much different. And they keep out everything from my dog's barking to my husband's snoring.
customer_reviews.author: Bernadette S. Loftus

customer_reviews.title: and holds them in place better. Only complaint is the tether material sticks to ...
customer_reviews.text: The stiff core makes these much easier to secure fully in the ear, and holds them in place better. Only complaint is the tether material sticks to the skin some, so it can pull on ear plugs some times. Others I've used slide on the skin better.
customer_reviews.author: Sawdust

customer_reviews.title: Very well made. I snipped the cord off as ...
customer_reviews.text: Very well made. I snipped the cord off as I wear plugs to bed (extremely noisy bedmate). The first night I found them to be less noise reducing than those I bought from my local Walmart store (2 in a clear pack container for less than 3 bucks). I think I was more intrigued by the color and that these came with a soft little pouch. I gave one pair to my son and haven't heard back from him on hispoint of view. I'm actually have these  in my shopping cart. Read this, and I hope it helps you as much as it did me,[...]
customer_reviews.author: onlyHischild

customer_reviews.title: Works well but needs a better storage container
customer_reviews.text: I've been using foam ear plugs for years but decided to give these a try. I didn't like how dirty foam plugs got, the time required for them to expand, and how easily they can fall on the ground. I use hearing protection with my air compressor, angle grinder, lawn mover, leaf blower and home renos. These plugs provide good sound protection, are easy to insert and remove, easy to find due to their bright colour, and the rubberized cord allows it to hang around your neck when not in use. It came with a black cloth pouch but I would have preferred a plastic container. Instead, I'm using a plastic food container to store them.
customer_reviews.author: N David

customer_reviews.title: Good sound cancelling, but not really ergonomic.
customer_reviews.text: I use those to sleep when my boyfriend is snoring and it works pretty well reducing the sounds and the cords allow me not to lose them during the night, but I feel like they are a bit invasive in the ears once I wake up... The plastic stick attached to it (and to the cord) could be shortened for a better fit, mostly for the ones who sleep on their side.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and work well.
customer_reviews.text: I have chronic migraines and these are my go-to when I need complete quiet. Or When I am around noisy machinery.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable all day.
customer_reviews.text: I use these on my motorcycle to reduce wind noise, and also on the job site, road construction and rebuilding. The only time I need a bit more noise reduction is when we are breaking concrete or power vaccing. I can wear them for 8 to 10 hours with no problem. They are easy to clean with soap and water, and hard to misplace with the cord.
customer_reviews.author: Ride Slow

customer_reviews.title: Overall the earplugs work fine. The amount of noise reduction works well also
customer_reviews.text: Overall the earplugs work fine. The amount of noise reduction works well also. I purchased these plugs because I have preferred this style of plug and cord. I did think this plug material is stiffer than other plugs I have used in the past causing them to be a little more uncomfortable than some other brands. I used this product for a week of construction activities for 8-12 hours a day.
customer_reviews.author: David Meyers

customer_reviews.title: I bought these to use while doing yard work. ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to use while doing yard work. I found them to be uncomfortable and you have to jam them around till you hit a spot where they seem to be working OK. But by the time I'm finishing up the yard they've moved and are doing nothing. I threw them out. I do woodworking and use full ear protection when running most of my loud tools. I would never wear the full ear protection when pushing a mower and figured the plugs would work but they didn't (at least for me). I'll next ry the disposable foam plugs.
customer_reviews.author: Hammer Head

customer_reviews.title: Brokers box
customer_reviews.text: Hello, I bought this article because it is 3M, they look good quality, the only detail is that the packaging is broken and that tells me that the article I bought has been used! I will not buy this item again
customer_reviews.author: Niko

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable & Reusable
customer_reviews.text: Use these at the gun range. Tired of buying one time use plugs. They work great and the color makes them easy to find.
customer_reviews.author: SueG

customer_reviews.title: Personal favorite.
customer_reviews.text: My go to ear plugs for work. I personally like these because they're tethered, so losing them in production, isn't an issue. I wash them, and reuse them, and probably get a good month use, before the plug snaps off the tether.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Bought several after trying one
customer_reviews.text: The stiff "handle" on these earplugs makes insertion MUCH easier than similar products' wobbly silicone "handles". I've replaced the old ones with these and after a couple of months' usage like 'em a lot.
customer_reviews.author: AlwaysBusy

customer_reviews.title: If you don't like the cord
customer_reviews.text: Tip: If you don't like the cord, You can carefully peel back the [silicon?] from the cord stem, then pop the bulb of the cord out without damaging the ear plugs themselves. I know not everyone likes small earplugs, but I absolutely love them like that. I wear them daily under my helmet when riding my motorcycle so the stem wouldn't work too well. As far as effectiveness; they're fantastic. They comfortable enough to wear for extended periods, and near fully block out the sounds of a helicopter turbine from <30'. I'll be getting more of these.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Smythe

customer_reviews.title: Excellent and economical hearing protection.
customer_reviews.text: These Peltor, three-flange, corded earplugs are the most comfortable I have used since the fitted silicon multi-flange plugs issued during my military experience (last century.) They also provide (my subjective impression) at least as good protection as any other product I have used, whether plugs or muffs. Given the combination of comfort, effectiveness and price, I am buying more to allow me to keep a pair in each rifle case and pistol rug I use.
customer_reviews.author: A Reasonable Person

customer_reviews.title: Work good and easy to find because they're always around my neck.
customer_reviews.text: I wear them constantly in my work shop. As I walk from machine to machine they're always hanging around my neck so I'm not looking for them. Because of this I wear them more often even on machines that not overwelmingly noisy, like palm sanders and drills.
customer_reviews.author: Bulldog

customer_reviews.title: Works great - just wish it came with a slightly better case
customer_reviews.text: I like to wear internal and external ear protection (ear plugs and muffs) and was tired of those throwaway foam ones you can get at the range. I liked the bright green for visibility and the lanyard that keeps them looped around your neck if you need to get in/out of the firing zone and don't want to put them back in your case or bag. They work well and I never have any ringing after shooting like I used to with the cheap foam earplugs. I only wish they included a better case (or three small ones!) since the tiny drawstring bag is pretty much useless. Keep them safe and unsquashed in an Altoids tin or similar box.
customer_reviews.author: Kaizoku!

customer_reviews.title: Sound-conducting Cord
customer_reviews.text: These earplugs fit well and feel deep to the point of almost being uncomfortable. They are easy to clean and remove without trouble. It does block loud sounds for me, much better than the foam earplugs which are a hassle to get right. I would prefer a rope attachment over this plastic cord, as it conducts sound while moving around which can be annoying at times. It's amazing how such little features make the difference between complete satisfaction and dissatisfaction, and should be determined when purchasing something again. My next choice might be to just get earmuff-style earphones to wear when practical to do so.
customer_reviews.author: Tronozon

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for me.
customer_reviews.text: For whatever reason, I could not get these to fit comfortably or block any sound at all. They felt like I'd have to insert them too far into my ear canal, causing discomfort. I processed a return and will be looking for a different option.
customer_reviews.author: Theo

customer_reviews.title: A lot better quality than the ones that were provided by my work at the time...
customer_reviews.text: That being said, they are hard as heck to keep clean after use as the wax builds up under the cones and cleaning makes me feel that they will rip or tear off... but I definitely recommend these!
customer_reviews.author: Clayton J. Morin

customer_reviews.title: Great cheap earplugs
customer_reviews.text: + Great price + Reusable + Easy to wash + Very effective at blocking sound - Color options are not great. I would like a grey/neutral white option
customer_reviews.author: Dove Family

customer_reviews.title: my animals like to chew them
customer_reviews.text: These are quite cheap compared to the really expensive ones, but they do work. Plus, my animals like to chew them, so I cannot afford to keep restocking the $25 ones. And since there are many in a pack, I have them in various places.
customer_reviews.author: wejo7185

customer_reviews.title: Would NOT Recommend
customer_reviews.text: Would NOT recommend. These earplugs fit well enough, however, the noise reduction is almost non-existent. I've used many types and these are the least effective. If your hearing is important to you, look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Goosetf3

customer_reviews.title: Terrible fit.
customer_reviews.text: These are too long and narrow for my ears. Worst. Fit. Ever. Not capable of blocking out any noise. Too bad I tried them or else I would have returned them. You get what you pay for. Not cheaping out on the next pair.
customer_reviews.author: Patrice C.

customer_reviews.title: Effective and Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: When I ordered these I didn't realize it was a three-pack. I was entirely satisfied to pay this price for one pair. These are handy and compact and easy to carry, and do a good job of blocking sound. I have various sets of earplugs and earmuffs for hobbies and shop work, but wanted something to stick in my pocket to have available for those situations where you just can't escape an annoying television receiver blaring nonsense and advertisements (such as doctor's waiting rooms and fast-food restaurants).
customer_reviews.author: William A. Parmley

customer_reviews.title: and the earplugs are good you can washed tio
customer_reviews.text: I work at the airport about 10 to 14 hours a day, and the earplugs are good you can washed tio, and still used. Cord are strong and fit to your ear good too.
customer_reviews.author: Xavier  Martinez  Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Pellor ear plugs with string
customer_reviews.text: Excellent in the ear noise reduction system, light, fits good, reusable, and protects your ears from gun shot sound, cleanup with soap and water, the string keep the plug easy to locate and adjust if needed. I would recommend it for all shooters instead or with sound mufflers!
customer_reviews.author: C. T. Geoghegan

customer_reviews.title: Don't bother! NO Stars deserved.
customer_reviews.text: These are the cheapest, most worthless excuses for ear plugs. Very cheaply made, and will do nothing to block sound, or water if getting them for swimming. They are soft plastic that don't even stay in the ear. DISAPPOINTING!!! Don't believe the positive reviews.
customer_reviews.author: jws

customer_reviews.title: Does exactly what I needed - Noise reduction
customer_reviews.text: They're light and they reduce noise. Easy to get in and pull out. They dampen the noise enough that the table saw and mitre saw aren't deafening, but also not so much that I get startled from behind. When I take them off they just hang around my neck and they're unobtrusive.
customer_reviews.author: Matt G

customer_reviews.title: Great for Concert venues
customer_reviews.text: Great ear plugs! I bought the V-MODA Faders VIP Tuned Metal Earplugs (also sold on Amazon) to wear to classes at the gym but I decided that maybe the V-MODA ones were blocking too much of the sound when we were attending concerts. I'm very happy with using these for concerts instead. They turn the volume down by about half but you still get more of the musical sounds. They are also very affordable.
customer_reviews.author: djw23

customer_reviews.title: My Favorite Earplugs!
customer_reviews.text: These are honestly the best ear plugs I have ever used while riding my motorcycle! They are comfortable and being attached together makes it nearly impossible to lose.
customer_reviews.author: Elementaryone

customer_reviews.title: Best noise cancellation
customer_reviews.text: I used multiple noise cancellation and this is by far the best. Prior to purchasing this item, I had on a ear plugs and a electronic shooting earmuffs to cancel out the noise from the shooting range. This items does a better job and no hassle from having a bulky earmuffs on during the summer at 90 degrees outdoor shooting range. Must try! You won’t regret.
customer_reviews.author: Diana

customer_reviews.title: If you want sound blocking as good and comfortable as foam ear plugs, look elsewhere
customer_reviews.text: In my experience, they work nowhere near as well as foam ear plugs, especially for something like sleeping, as these have a long hard plastic tab that prevent you from laying on your side. I've also noticed that these have to be so far in your ear that they hurt for the third layer of the "tri flange" to work, and with only two, everything is still easily audible.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: Super comfortable and high visibility
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable, works great, easy to see. Don’t push them in too far because unlike foam, they work great when their ridges are in the proper spot. Too far and not as much protection. These were cheaper then 2 of the corded foam 3 M ones
customer_reviews.author: Casey

customer_reviews.title: Very convenient to use and carry.
customer_reviews.text: These are very easy to use. Yet, they are not nearly as effective as wearing earmuffs. But, we shouldn't expect them to work as well as muffs (and I don't expect them to). I wear these when using a gas-powered air blower. I like to use plugs instead of muffs so that I can wear a hat at the same time. Maybe I was expecting too much. But, I was hoping they would block just a little more noise. Yet, they do help.
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: Loud roommates, an I right!
customer_reviews.text: Sometimes I have a hard time finding earplugs if they're those single foam ones and floating around my drawer somewhere. Or other typs on a string hurt for some reason. These feel good and I just hang them on my bed post for easy access.
customer_reviews.author: Mari

customer_reviews.title: They are much better than the flimsy foam ones and can be reused ...
customer_reviews.text: I work as a bouncer at a night club and let me tell you...I take my hearing seriously, so I do what I can to protect it from harmful loud music and decibels that I'm exposed to every weekend. They are much better than the flimsy foam ones and can be reused over and over again.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Soft, comfrotable fit that really reduces noise!
customer_reviews.text: These are great! I have a lot of power equipment to maintain our small farmette and these drastically reduce the noise from power washers, tractors, mowers etc. They are very comfortable in the ear and seem to just fit right. Also easy to remove. Love that they have a string to keep them around my neck when I take them out. Seems like soft, and good quality material that does not irritate my ears. Easy to clean in soapy water if desired.
customer_reviews.author: BWrightThere

customer_reviews.title: comfy and easy to remove
customer_reviews.text: I have longer fingernails and have a hard time removing this type of ear plug from my ear without having the cord to help pull it out. So these work well for me. They are relatively comfortable, won't get lost easily and I like that they come with several pairs.
customer_reviews.author: JIR

customer_reviews.title: Didn't detect much decrease
customer_reviews.text: Was taking my son and his mate to see Monster truck Jam, and the adults needed hearing protection ( the kids had full-on peltor ear defnders), so thought we'd try these as they indicated good noise reduction. I've tried peltor ear defenders, panasonic powered noise reduction headphones, and good old fashioned 3M ear plugs, and all worked better than thse. You put them in and there was no discernable decrease in volume, that I could tell, especially when compared with other "plugs". The string and carry bag were nice.
customer_reviews.author: wattsie

customer_reviews.title: Works well, handy, portable
customer_reviews.text: Excellent sound barrier for outdoor firearms practice. Although these do not do the job of an over-the-ear ear-muff, it is stiff effective. I do not recommend for indoor shooting range. These provide a bit better sound dampening than the foam ear-inserts.
customer_reviews.author: Byron Magbee

customer_reviews.title: I experience better acoustics and clearer speech
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to protect my hearing where I workout. The music is painfully loud and these work so well, I'm able to continue going to classes. They muffle the volume but not the clarity of speech. I experience better acoustics and clearer speech, with these in my ears. The stay in well, feel very secure. Quick easy insert and removal. The cord that attaches them is a nice feature so they're always together.
customer_reviews.author: dawtravelbug

customer_reviews.title: Tri Flange again is tops for me
customer_reviews.text: An order I had placed several years ago had a fabric lanyard. This "new and improved style" has a plastic lanyard. I was disappointed it this development HOWEVER, although this was a concern to me the actual ear plug is as good or better than the original. I have used these ear plugs in hot and cold conditions and I am pleased with them. This tri flange style fits and eliminates sound for me significantly better than the foam style.
customer_reviews.author: Peter V.

customer_reviews.title: The best earplugs
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had many different kinds of earplugs for shooting at outdoor ranges. These earplugs really work extremely well. I even bought 2 packages to make sure I always have them on hand.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: PLUG YOUR EARHOLE BEFORE YOU GO DEAF
customer_reviews.text: Fits comfortably and blocks out loud noise. Shove each plug into your ear canal to silence the nagging wife. Wash off the ear wax and reuse. A small cloth pouch is included. Completely worth it!
customer_reviews.author: P. J. Fudder

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME!
customer_reviews.text: AWESOME! These work better then any ear protection I have tried. I work around heavy equipment and loud machinery and wearing these plugs I have ample hearing protection yet can still hear equipment moving around me so I'm aware of the dangers around me at all times. I have also used these for sleeping when I work nights and must sleep through a newborn baby and 4 year old that doesn't understand quiet, and they are comfortable even when sleeping directly on the ear that they are in! Florescent green color makes them easy to find. This is one of those few products you wish you could give more then 5 stars!
customer_reviews.author: jason l ward

customer_reviews.title: Great noise reduction, really comfortable, great value
customer_reviews.text: I've had a few different models of rubber (non-foam) earplugs, and so far these are the best. There is one thing that really makes these plugs better than others: *the stem is flexible*. This means that the plug stem bends according to your ear canal, which makes it much more comfortable. The noise reduction is also on the high side, also more than competitor plugs. The cord is plastic and not too strong. I like to cut them off. At three pairs for this price, it's hard to find better value. And it also comes with one little handy pouch.
customer_reviews.author: Fabrício

customer_reviews.title: Very Comfortable, Very Effective
customer_reviews.text: These take a little getting used to if you are more accustomed to using ear muffs for hearing protection, but they are worth the switch. At first I wasn't sure if they were adequate for shooting, but it was because I didn't have them seated in my ear properly. If you get them in your ear properly so that there is a good seal, the noise reduction is stark, and more than enough for shooting. Gone are the days of messing with how your glasses fit under your muffs, and these will make shooting a lot more comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Better than a big ear protector
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable lightweight convenient for my shooting sport, I don’t like wear a big ear protector because it is heavy hot and not easy to take! This one is good enough.
customer_reviews.author: Luffy

product_meta.title: Peltor Sport Tri-Flange Corded Reusable Earplugs, 3-Pair Per Pack
product_meta.description:
Tri-Flange Reusable Earplugs feature a triple-flange design that helps provide a custom fit. The patented flanges and flexible stem are made of a soft, non-irritating polymer to help provide protection and comfort.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
The AOSafety Select line of safety includes a wide selection of personal protective equipment that is designed, styled and sized to meet the needs of women.
feature_bullets: Triple-flange design for snug, comfortable fit
Cord helps reduce the chance of loss when not in use
3-pair pack includes storage container to help keep plugs clean when not being worn

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars1,317 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
